Uses of Interface
fast3d.Renderable

  • Packages that use Renderable 
    Package Description
    fast3d

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d

      Methods in fast3d that return Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Renderable Panel3d.pickClosest(int x, int y)
      used to pick the closest-to-the-camera Renderable of all Renderables in the Universe by click on the panel
      may return null if rayTracing is not supported by the universe or no Renderable was detected
      Methods in fast3d that return types with arguments of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> Panel3d.pick(int x, int y)
      used to pick all Renderables by click on the panel
      may return null if rayTracing is not supported by the universe or no Renderable was detected
      works like a 3d-click

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.complex

      Classes in fast3d.complex with type parameters of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  RenderableRenderAction<T extends Renderable>
      a render-action is called when the graphics3d sort()-methods calls it's parameter values for example
      Classes in fast3d.complex that implement Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Group
      a class to combine multiple triangles
      the renderable interface is implemented just to make this addable to an universe and to make it detectable by raytracing, on call of render nothing happens
      note: to add this to an universe does not mean to add the triangles to the universe, but just to make clicking and selecting work
      a group is just a way of organizing data for a scenery or an object, considering the model-view-controller model it is requested to used addToUniverse() instead of adding this to a universe
      hint: although the contained Renderables can build an 3d-object, they can be independent
      class  Object
      a class to combine multiple groups
      the renderable interface is implemented just to make this addable to an universe and to make it detectable by ray tracing
      note: to add this to an universe does not mean to add the groups to the universe, but just to make clicking and selecting work
      although the contained groups can be part of a 3d-object, they can be independent
      class  Scene
      a class to combine multiple Objects
      the renderable interface is implemented just to make this addable to an universe and to make it detectable by ray tracing
      note: to add this to an universe does not mean to add the objects to the universe, but just to make clicking and selecting work
      although the contained objects can be part of a stringent 3d-scenery, they can be independent
      Methods in fast3d.complex that return Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Renderable[] Universe.getObjs()
      may just be called from getObjsSorted()
      Renderable[] Universe.getObjsSorted() 
      Methods in fast3d.complex that return types with arguments of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> Universe.rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      1)on a picking-action on the holding panel3d this method is called to determine, which Renderables may be targeted
      2)on a lighting-calculation the lighting-method will call rayTrace to determine whether some rays of light my be obstructed and now some objects lay in the shadow
      this method should call rayTrace for every Renderable that is in the universes internal storage and list the Renderables which return not null from that method in a result-list
      Methods in fast3d.complex with parameters of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Universe.add(Renderable... r)
      synchronized add to the internal renderables-storage
      boolean Scene.collides(Renderable r)
      collides if any of its objects collides
      boolean Object.collides(Renderable r)
      collides if any of its groups collides
      boolean Group.collides(Renderable r)
      if the parameter is not a group, every triangle of this will be checked for collision, this collides if any of its triangles collides
      if the parameter is a group if this.collisionSphereRadius equals zero, an triangle-to-triangle-collision-detection will be done, this collides if any of its triangles collides to any of the parameters triangles if the collisionSphereRadius is greater than zero, this collides if the distance between this position-vector and the parameters position-vector is not greater than the collisionSphereRadius of this if the collisionSphereRadius is less than zero, this collides if the distance between this position-vector and the parameters position-vector is not greater than the collisionSphereRadius of the parameter
      void Universe.remove(Renderable... r)
      synchronized remove to the internal renderables-storage

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.complex.light

      Subinterfaces of Renderable in fast3d.complex.light 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Illuminatable
      a renderable is illuminatable if it has a surface that can be colored considering the universes lighting data
      Methods in fast3d.complex.light that return types with arguments of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> ObstructableLight.obstructings(Illuminatable l)
      should be used by illuminate(Illuminatable) to determine whether the Illuminatable to currently illuminate lays in the shadow of another

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.graphics

      Methods in fast3d.graphics with parameters of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Graphics3d.sort(Renderable... r)
      sorts the given array very fast but correct to draw the renderables then in the order of the array, so that they will hide each other in the perspectively correct order
      the nearest to the camera renderable will be at the last index of the array, the most far one at first

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.mtOpt

      Constructors in fast3d.mtOpt with parameters of type Renderable 
      Constructor and Description
      SharedShader(Renderable[] list, int offset, int length)
      multiple SharedShaders work on one list, each from offset length Renderables long

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.renderables

      Classes in fast3d.renderables that implement Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AdvTriangle
      an advanced version of triangle3d that is illuminatable with any built-in light
      getColor() returns the current visible color
      class  Callout
      a callout is a 2d-text floating on a 3d-location, facing the camera, heading up
      the callout uses a built-in font class
      class  CrosshairHUD
      a simple crosshair in the middle of the screen
      class  HUD
      a base class to draw on 2d over the 3d-scene
      a HeadUpDisplay is not ray-traceable
      a basic HUDs 3d-location given by getPos() is at the cameras location instantly after any render call
      a basic HUD returns null for its color
      a HUD do not block any events on the 3d-scenery (used by controls for instance) - it is only a class to represent something visually on the screen, but not "physically" in the universe
      class  Line
      a line in 3d space with width of 1 pixel
      lines disappear on mathematically correct ray-tracing imaging, because they have no actual width (like when using the DefaultFragmentShader)
      class  Pixel
      visualized like a 3d-pixel (a point with a width of 1px and a color)
      no matter how far the camera is away, a pixel will always be shaded to the size of one single pixel on the screen
      points/pixels disappear on mathematically correct ray-tracing imaging, because they have no actual width (like when using the DefaultFragmentShader)
      class  Rectangle
      a simple, not illuminated (but with constant color) rectangle in space
      class  Triangle
      a simple, not illuminated (but with constant color) triangle in space

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.simple

      Methods in fast3d.simple that return Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Renderable[] SimpleUniverse.getObjs()
      sometimes it may be useful to have all Renderables at one time as array
      Renderable[] SimpleUniverse.getObjsSorted()
      to render all objects, it is necessary to order them by distance to the camera
      the best way of sorting is detected automatically
      Methods in fast3d.simple that return types with arguments of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> SimpleUniverse.rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r) 
      Methods in fast3d.simple with parameters of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void SimpleUniverse.add(Renderable... r)
      synchronized variant to objs.add()
      all renderables are asked for their vertices which than are stored in an internal list
      void SimpleUniverse.remove(Renderable... r)
      synchronized variant to objs.remove()
      all renderables are asked for their vertices which than are removed from an internal list

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.util

      Methods in fast3d.util with parameters of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void Sort.Quicksort.Renderables.sort(Vector3d campos, int left, int right, Renderable... r)
      sorts the renderables in the specified range of the given array in relation to their distance to the campos
      static void Sort.Quicksort.Renderables.sort(Vector3d campos, Renderable... r)
      sorts all the renderables in relation to their distance to the campos
      static void Sort.Bubblesort.Renderables.sort(Vector3d campos, Renderable... r)
      sorts the given renderable-array in relation to the renderables distance to the camera considering the painters algorithm

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.util.click

      Methods in fast3d.util.click with parameters of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ClickListener3d.clicked(Renderable... r)
      called after rayTracing of a user click

    • Uses of Renderable in fast3d.util.math

      Methods in fast3d.util.math with parameters of type Renderable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static GeometricObject RelationshipAnalytics.findCorrespond(Renderable r)
      for a given renderable that is instance either of the following the result will be the geometric object that contains the renderable as a subset of points Pixel to Point Line to Straight Triangle or Rectangle to Plate
